meanings.sent1: That dingbat always forgets where he parked his car.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the dingbat for not paying attention in class.
meanings.sent3: The dingbat tried to wear socks on his hands instead of gloves.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dingbat when she realized she was wearing mismatched shoes.
meanings.sent5: Don't be a dingbat and remember to bring your umbrella on a rainy day.

meanings.definition: A typographical symbol or ornament, such as an asterisk or bullet.
meanings.sent1: The document had a dingbat at the end of each paragraph.
meanings.sent2: The designer used a dingbat to separate the sections in the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The dingbat on the page looked like a tiny star.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the dingbat that marked the beginning of the chapter.
meanings.sent5: The dingbat added a touch of elegance to the invitation card.
